description: {"blocks":[{"key":"b5scn","text":"This protocol describes the process followed to perform localised axotomy of iPSC-derived human cortical axons cultured within fluid-walled dumbbells in 6 cm TCT-treated Petri dishes. A similar protocol was first described by Soitu et al., 2020 to perform wounds assays in monolayer cell cultures. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":226,"length":18}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"917E2C00E2B011EDBB12B5B7AB615DBA","url":"https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/33598064/"}}}}
keywords: Laplace pressure, automatic flow, dumbbell circuits, fluid-walled microfluidics
materials_text: {"blocks":[{"key":"601si","text":"Reagents:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"sqgb","text":"B-27™ Supplement (50X), serum free (ThermoFisher Scientific, CAT# 17504044)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":34}],"data":{}},{"key":"2tvv8","text":"FC40 (iotaSciences Ltd, CAS# 51142-49-5)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":1,"offset":0,"length":4}],"data":{}},{"key":"9p462","text":"Neurobasal (ThermoFisher Scientific, CAT#2113049)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ab4t9","text":"Phosphate-buffered saline, pH 7.4 (PBS) (Life Technologies, CAT# 10010056)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":2,"offset":0,"length":25}],"data":{}},{"key":"cg26b","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"2lri2","text":"Equipment:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"71c60","text":"In-house Fluid Printer (iotaSciences Ltd.)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"d91rt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"e91d8","text":"Preparation of coating-prep medium:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":35}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6a3tj","text":"Neurobasal","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6ovt3","text":"1x B-27 parent_collections.title: Do, Q. B. & Nebuloni, F. et al. (2023) A fluid walled microfluidic platform for human neuronal microcircuits and axotomy.
Do, Q. B. & Nebuloni, F. et al. (2023) A fluid walled microfluidic platform for human neuronal microcircuits and axotomy.

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"53qrm","text":"On Day 20, remove the FC40 overlay from the Petri dish where human Cortical Neurons (CNs) were cultured inside fluid-walled dumbbells.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qqqs","text":"Gently add ~2 ml of coating-prep medium (see Materials) to destroy every fluid wall without peeling cells off the substrate. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":45,"length":9}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"88ns7","text":"Remove medium and wash with PBS twice. Be careful with cells peeling. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":39,"length":31}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"jvrd","text":"After last wash, add ~5 ml of fresh medium (Neurobasal supplemented with B27). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"9705k","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"llkt","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"6p935","text":"Cells can now be stored in incubator for several minutes if needed.","type":"unstyled"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ha70","text":"Equip the fluid printer with a 1 mL glass syringe filled with medium.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"bk9qv","text":"Fluid printer automatically perform axotomy by means of a submerged medium jet. Such jet is held at a fixed height above cells and it is moved around the dish by the printer traverse to cross perpendicularly across axon bundles at the midpoint. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6kfse","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"44qjb","text":"Key parameters:","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":15}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"f594v","text":"jet height =300 μm","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"7qk9q","text":"jet flow rate = 480 μl/min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1kqnj","text":"traverse speed = 960 mm/min","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6i08n","text":" ","type":"atomic","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":0,"length":1}],"data":{}},{"key":"5jqok","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"notes","mutability":"IMMUTABLE","data":{"blocks":[{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"2fpm","text":"Parameters must be finely tuned, depending on cells maturation and concentration.","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"4oqcu","text":"","type":"align-justify"},{"data":{},"depth":0,"entityRanges":[],"inlineStyleRanges":[],"key":"el17b","text":"Fluid printer is controlled by scripts written in G-code.","type":"align-justify"}],"entityMap":{}}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dr0om","text":"New fluid-walled dumbbells can be fabricated around axotomized cultures following steps 1.5 and 1.6 in Protocol: Fabrication of fluid-walled dumbbells and generation of the human corticostriatal pathway","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":82,"length":17},{"style":"bold","offset":102,"length":100}],"entityRanges":[{"key":0,"offset":103,"length":99}],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{"0":{"type":"link","mutability":"MUTABLE","data":{"guid":"B27FF610E37611EDB6397B82542F27DE","url":"https://www.protocols.io/private/88114D35E2A811EDAF7C0A58A9FEAC02"}}}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"fur62","text":"On DIV 0, fluorescent live images of all dumbbell conduits were taken just prior to CNs replating to serve as initial normalising timepoint. ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"ds33f","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"40b3v","text":"Medium was changed every other day from now on for the next 20 days.","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"q3on","text":"Images were taken on a digital SLR camera (Nikon D7100 DSLR) connected to an epi-fluorescence microscope (Olympus IX53; 1.25×, 4×, 10×, 25× objectives) equipped with a translation stage and an overhead illuminator (Olympus IX3 with filters). ","type":"align-justify","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7cno7","text":"Similar live images were taken again on day 20 prior to axotomy, and subsequently 36, 60, and 84 hours post-axotomy.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Localised axotomy of human Cortical Neurons (CNs) from induced pluripotent stem cells (iPSCs)
